Text:
All these people are on their way to see the Jugang
Ruins, right?
Is the crowd really going to disperse before evening?
It will. It was like a receding tide yesterday.

The Academic District gets quiet in the evenings.
There are a few places to have dinner or drinks,
but there really is no nightlife to speak of.

There's no beach to hang out at at night here, and to
top it all off, there's a noise ordinance that's strictly
enforced.

I see... So when they've had their fill here, they'll
all rush back to the Tourist District.

That's right. So, here we are, relaxing, having a cup
of tea, waiting for the evening to come.
You really do write everywhere you go, don't you?

Not everywhere! Besides, don't think I'm not enjoying
myself.

It's just...sitting here in a foreign cafe, enjoying
the exotic atmosphere with a cup of iced tea...
I can't help but want to write.
Doesn't it feel all so extraordinary to you?
For us, everything is extraordinary, I suppose.

I guess we are enjoying the extraordinary everyday
life here.
Epsilon!

Then, if you don't enjoy it as much as you can,
you're missing out!
Beta...
You're right!

Forgive me, Lady Alpha, but I think I'm gonna let my
hair down for a bit, too!
Epsilon...

I know. That's a skilled-looking fighter heading
toward the ruins. There's still 30 minutes left to
go before the tour ends.

The fact that they are heading straight for the ruins
at this hour means that they have some business
inside.

What should we do? Sneak in right away? Or wait until
the night?

If there's a high probability that there'll be others
around, it might be better to wait for the night.
Copy that.

...It's a very strange feeling to see the ocean like
this.
Strange? How so?

It's a long way from our capital to the
southern coast, isn't it?

And yet, in this city, just a short walk and the
coastline is right there in front of you.

It truly is a big world, and it has many faces to
show us.
...Spoken like a true author.

That's because I am one. You don't feel anything,
Epsilon?

Of course I do. I was just thinking about how the
waves sound different here compared to how
they sound south of the capital.

What a musician-like thing to say. Do they really
sound different?

I am a musician. But yeah... They're similar, yet
clearly different.

It's like how the same piano can make a different
sound depending on who is playing it.

It is only natural that the sound of waves, with all
the natural variations of each coast, would sound
different in each place, isn't it?

The conditions look the same, but the output is
different. Pretty much like us and our jobs at the
Garden.

I guess it's like how we're all Seven Shadows, but we
each have our own personalities.

...Didn't you have to go through a certain amount of
hardship before you were able to say that kind of
thing with such confidence?
That's mutual as far as we are concerned, isn't it?
Maybe. But not just us. Gamma, too.
...Well, shall we begin?
Yes. Let's!
